content: Many people consider themselves too sophisticated to enjoy country-western music. I think this young man will change many minds and vindicate all who have enjoyed this music from it's inception. >http://www.qinetiq.nl/pivot/entry.php?id=1863&t=v2_mediapage_template.html

title: Common ground for the music lovers of this forum.

content: I have ecletic and catholic (small c) interests in music, ranging from Scots/Irish folk through Pipes & Drums to the best that Country has to offer. I have every regular CD album that George Strait and the incomparable Merle Haggard have ever put out (and material that was never released commercially) plus a decent selection of Jones, Willie, Waylon, Alan Jackson Gary Stewart and Guy Clark etc. Sadly, many of the modern acts are Pop disguised as Country.
